name: cifti-parcellate
author: Connectome Workbench Developers
description:
Parcellate a cifti file.

Each label (other than the unlabeled key) in the cifti label file will be treated as a parcel, and all rows or columns of data within the parcel are averaged together to form the parcel's output row or column.  If -legacy-mode is specified, parcels will be defined as the overlap between a label and the data, with no errors for missing data vertices or voxels, and empty parcels discarded.  The direction can be either an integer starting from 1, or the strings 'ROW' or 'COLUMN'.  For dtseries or dscalar, use COLUMN.  If you are parcellating a dconn in both directions, parcellating by ROW first will use much less memory.

NOTE: the parcels in the output file are sorted by the numeric label keys, in ascending order.

The parameter to the -method option must be one of the following:

MAX: the maximum value
MIN: the minimum value
INDEXMAX: the 1-based index of the maximum value
INDEXMIN: the 1-based index of the minimum value
SUM: add all values
PRODUCT: multiply all values
MEAN: the mean of the data
STDEV: the standard deviation (N denominator)
SAMPSTDEV: the sample standard deviation (N-1 denominator)
VARIANCE: the variance of the data
TSNR: mean divided by sample standard deviation (N-1 denominator)
COV: sample standard deviation (N-1 denominator) divided by mean
L2NORM: square root of sum of squares
MEDIAN: the median of the data
MODE: the mode of the data
COUNT_NONZERO: the number of nonzero elements in the data

The -*-weights options are mutually exclusive and may only be used with MEAN (default), SUM, STDEV, SAMPSTDEV, VARIANCE, MEDIAN, or MODE (default for label data).

inputs.name: cifti_in
inputs.description: the cifti file to parcellate

inputs.name: cifti_label
inputs.description: a cifti label file to use for the parcellation

inputs.name: direction
inputs.description: which mapping to parcellate (integer, ROW, or COLUMN)

inputs.name: cifti_out
inputs.description: output cifti file

inputs.name: spatial_weights
inputs.description: use voxel volume and either vertex areas or metric files as weights

type.name: spatial_weights
type.description: use voxel volume and either vertex areas or metric files as weights

inputs.name: opt_left_area_surf_left_surf
inputs.description: use a surface for left vertex areas: the left surface to use, areas are in mm^2

inputs.name: opt_right_area_surf_right_surf
inputs.description: use a surface for right vertex areas: the right surface to use, areas are in mm^2

inputs.name: opt_cerebellum_area_surf_cerebellum_surf
inputs.description: use a surface for cerebellum vertex areas: the cerebellum surface to use, areas are in mm^2

inputs.name: opt_left_area_metric_left_metric
inputs.description: use a metric file for left vertex weights: metric file containing left vertex weights

inputs.name: opt_right_area_metric_right_metric
inputs.description: use a metric file for right vertex weights: metric file containing right vertex weights

inputs.name: opt_cerebellum_area_metric_cerebellum_metric
inputs.description: use a metric file for cerebellum vertex weights: metric file containing cerebellum vertex weights

inputs.name: opt_cifti_weights_weight_cifti
inputs.description: use a cifti file containing weights: the weights to use, as a cifti file

inputs.name: opt_method_method
inputs.description: specify method of parcellation (default MEAN, or MODE if label data): the method to use to assign parcel values from the values of member brainordinates

inputs.name: exclude_outliers
inputs.description: exclude non-numeric values and outliers from each parcel by standard deviation

type.name: exclude_outliers
type.description: exclude non-numeric values and outliers from each parcel by standard deviation

inputs.name: sigma_below
inputs.description: number of standard deviations below the mean to include

inputs.name: sigma_above
inputs.description: number of standard deviations above the mean to include

inputs.name: opt_only_numeric
inputs.description: exclude non-numeric values

inputs.name: opt_fill_value_value
inputs.description: specify value to use in empty parcels (default 0): the value to fill empty parcels with

inputs.name: opt_nonempty_mask_out_mask_out
inputs.description: output a matching pscalar file that has 0s in empty parcels, and 1s elsewhere: the output mask file

inputs.name: opt_legacy_mode
inputs.description: use the old behavior, parcels are defined by the intersection between labels and valid data, and empty parcels are discarded

inputs.name: opt_include_empty
inputs.description: deprecated: now the default behavior

output-files.name: opt_nonempty_mask_out_mask_out
output-files.description: output a matching pscalar file that has 0s in empty parcels, and 1s elsewhere: the output mask file
